messageBody:
## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )
## Message Type: Space Weather Notification - CME (OSIRIS-APEX, Missions Near Earth)
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-25T21:21:54Z
## Message ID: 20250825-AL-005
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

C-type CME detected by STEREO A / GOES / SOHO. 

Start time of the event: 2025-08-25T09:36Z.

Estimated speed: ~635 km/s.

Estimated opening half-angle: 21 deg.

Direction (lon./lat.): 0/-37 in Heliocentric Earth Equatorial coordinates.

Activity ID: 2025-08-25T09:36:00-CME-001

Based on preliminary analysis by the Moon to Mars Space Weather Analysis Office and heliospheric modeling carried out at NASA Community Coordinated Modeling Center, it is estimated that this CME may affect OSIRIS-APEX (glancing blow). The flank of the CME will reach OSIRIS-APEX at 2025-08-28T08:00Z (plus minus 7 hours). 

The simulation also indicates that the CME may have a glancing blow at NASA missions near Earth. Simulations indicate that the flank of the CME may reach NASA missions near Earth at about 2025-08-28T08:00Z (plus minus 7 hours). The roughly estimated expected range of the maximum Kp index is 3-5 (below minor to minor).
  
Links to the movies of the modeled event (includes CME: 2025-08-25T09:36:00-CME-001):

http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250825_142500_2.0_anim.tim-den.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250825_142500_2.0_anim.tim-vel.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250825_142500_2.0_ENLIL_CONE_timeline.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250825_142500_2.0_ENLIL_CONE_Osiris_timeline.gif


## Notes: 


SCORE CME typification system:
S-type: CMEs with speeds less than 500 km/s
C-type: Common 500-999 km/s
O-type: Occasional 1000-1999 km/s
R-type: Rare 2000-2999 km/s
ER-type: Extremely Rare >3000 km/s

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )
## Message Type: Space Weather Notification - SEP Prediction
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-25T20:07:36Z
## Message ID: 20250825-AL-004
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

Solar energetic particle event forecasted near L1 orbit by the HESPERIA RELeASE model starting at 2025-08-25T17:55Z.  The flux of one or more of the >15.8 MeV protons channels may exceed 10^(-1) pfu/MeV within next few hours.

NASA spacecraft at the orbits at the L1 and near-Earth orbits can be impacted.

Activity ID: 2025-08-25T17:55:00-SEP-001.

## Notes: 

This SEP prediction (2025-08-25T17:55:00-SEP-001) is associated with CME with ID 2025-08-21T08:23:00-CME-001 (see notifications 20250821-AL-001 and 20250821-AL-002).

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )

##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-25T13:34:02Z
## Message ID: 20250825-AL-003
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

Solar energetic particle event detected by GOES.  The flux of > 10 MeV protons exceeds 10 pfu starting at 2025-08-25T13:20Z.

NASA spacecraft at MEO, GEO and other high-altitude orbits and high-inclination LEO can be impacted.

Activity ID: 2025-08-25T13:20:00-SEP-001.

## Notes: 

This SEP event (2025-08-25T13:20:00-SEP-001) is associated with O-type CME with ID 2025-08-21T08:23:00-CME-001 (see notifications 20250821-AL-001 and 20250821-AL-002).

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )
## Message Type: Space Weather Notification - CME (Psyche, Mars)
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-25T01:56:19Z
## Message ID: 20250825-AL-001
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

C-type CME detected by STEREO A / GOES / SOHO. 

Start time of the event: 2025-08-24T23:00Z.

Estimated speed: ~759 km/s.

Estimated opening half-angle: 16 deg.

Direction (lon./lat.): -92/-3 in Heliocentric Earth Equatorial coordinates.

Activity ID: 2025-08-24T23:00:00-CME-001

Based on preliminary analysis by the Moon to Mars Space Weather Analysis Office and heliospheric modeling carried out at NASA Community Coordinated Modeling Center, it is estimated that the CME may impact Psyche (minor impact) and Mars (glancing blow). The leading edge of the CME will reach Psyche at 2025-09-01T00:00Z and the flank will reach Mars at 2025-08-29T00:00Z (plus minus 7 hours). 

Links to the movies of the modeled event (includes CMEs: 2025-08-24T12:12:00-CME-001, 2025-08-24T23:00:00-CME-001):

(a) 2 AU outer boundary
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250824_221600_2.0_anim.tim-den.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250824_221600_2.0_anim.tim-vel.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250824_221600_2.0_ENLIL_CONE_timeline.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250824_221600_2.0_ENLIL_CONE_Mars_timeline.gif

(b) 5.5 AU outer boundary
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250824_221600_5.5_anim.tim-den.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250824_221600_5.5_anim.tim-vel.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250824_221600_5.5_ENLIL_CONE_Psyche_timeline.gif


## Notes: 
The linked simulation results also include an S-type CME with ID 2025-08-24T12:12:00-CME-001.

SCORE CME typification system:
S-type: CMEs with speeds less than 500 km/s
C-type: Common 500-999 km/s
O-type: Occasional 1000-1999 km/s
R-type: Rare 2000-2999 km/s
ER-type: Extremely Rare >3000 km/s

## Summary:

Solar energetic particle event detected by SOHO.  The flux of the >15.8 MeV protons channels exceeds 10^(-1) pfu/MeV starting at 2025-08-24T17:20Z.

NASA spacecraft at L1 and near-Earth orbits can be impacted.

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )
## Message Type: Auto-generated Space Weather Notification - Radiation Belt Enhancement
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-24T13:51:33Z
## Message ID: 20250824-AL-001
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

Significantly elevated energetic electron fluxes in the Earth's outer radiation belt. GOES "greater than 2.0 MeV" integral electron flux is above 1000 pfu starting at 2025-08-24T13:40Z. 


NASA spacecraft at GEO, MEO and other orbits passing through or in the vicinity of the Earth's outer radiation belt can be impacted.

Activity ID: 2025-08-24T13:40:00-RBE-001. 

## Notes:

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )
## Message Type: Space Weather Notification - Continued Radiation Belt Enhancement
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-23T17:50:52Z
## Message ID: 20250823-AL-002
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

Significantly elevated energetic electron fluxes in the Earth's outer radiation belt. GOES "greater than 2.0 MeV" integral electron flux first crossed the threshold of 1000 pfu starting at 2025-08-21T17:10Z. The most recent crossing of the 1000 pfu threshold was at 2022-07-26T17:20Z and the fluxes are currently elevated but below the threshold.

The elevated energetic electron flux levels are caused by a high speed stream which arrived on 2025-08-18, reaching a maximum speed of approximately 650 km/s. The solar wind speed observed at L1 is currently around 420 km/s.

NASA spacecraft at GEO, MEO and other orbits passing through or in the vicinity of the Earth's outer radiation belt can be impacted.

Activity ID: 2025-08-21T17:10:00-RBE-001. 

## Notes:

Start time of the event: 2025-08-23T02:23Z.

Estimated speed: ~883 km/s.

Estimated opening half-angle: 18 deg.

Based on preliminary analysis by the Moon to Mars Space Weather Analysis Office and heliospheric modeling carried out at NASA Community Coordinated Modeling Center, it is estimated that the CME may impact BepiColombo (glancing blow) and Juice (glancing blow).  The flank of the CME may reach BepiColombo at 2025-08-24T02:00Z and Juice at 2025-08-25T16:00Z (plus minus 7 hours). 

Links to the movies of the modeled event (includes CME: 2025-08-23T02:23:00-CME-001):

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )
## Message Type: Space Weather Notification - CME (Lucy, Europa Clipper, Psyche, Mars)
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-22T22:21:49Z
## Message ID: 20250822-AL-002
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

C-type CME detected by GOES / STEREO A. 

Start time of the event: 2025-08-22T19:30Z.

Estimated speed: ~737 km/s.

Estimated opening half-angle: 45 deg.

Direction (lon./lat.): -95/-15 in Heliocentric Earth Equatorial coordinates.

Activity ID: 2025-08-22T19:30:00-CME-001

Based on preliminary analysis by the Moon to Mars Space Weather Analysis Office and heliospheric modeling carried out at NASA Community Coordinated Modeling Center, it is estimated that the CME may impact Lucy (glancing blow), Europa Clipper (glancing blow), Psyche, and Mars.  The flank of the CME may reach Lucy at 2025-09-01T00:00Z and Europa Clipper at 2025-08-28T00:00Z (plus minus 7 hours). The leading edge of the CME will reach Psyche at 2025-08-29T18:50Z, and Mars at 2025-08-26T19:54Z (plus minus 7 hours). 

Links to the movies of the modeled event (includes CME: 2025-08-22T19:30:00-CME-001):

(a) 2 AU outer boundary
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_2.0_anim.tim-den.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_2.0_anim.tim-vel.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_2.0_ENLIL_CONE_timeline.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_2.0_ENLIL_CONE_Mars_timeline.gif

(b) 5.5 AU outer boundary
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_5.5_anim.tim-den.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_5.5_anim.tim-vel.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_5.5_ENLIL_CONE_Lucy_timeline.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_5.5_ENLIL_CONE_Psyche_timeline.gif
http://iswa.gsfc.nasa.gov/downloads/20250822_234100_5.5_ENLIL_CONE_EuropaClippr_timeline.gif


## Notes: 

This CME event (2025-08-22T19:30:00-CME-001) is associated with M1.7 flare from an unnumbered region beyond the SE limb near S17E90 with ID 2025-08-22T18:55:00-FLR-001 which peaked at 2025-08-22T18:59Z.


SCORE CME typification system:
S-type: CMEs with speeds less than 500 km/s
C-type: Common 500-999 km/s
O-type: Occasional 1000-1999 km/s
R-type: Rare 2000-2999 km/s
ER-type: Extremely Rare >3000 km/s

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information ( CCMC DONKI )
## Message Type: Space Weather Notification - Radiation Belt Enhancement
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-21T18:14:41Z
## Message ID: 20250821-AL-004
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

Significantly elevated energetic electron fluxes in the Earth's outer radiation belt. GOES "greater than 2.0 MeV" integral electron flux is above 1000 pfu starting at 2025-08-21T17:10Z. 

The elevated energetic electron flux levels are caused by a coronal hole high speed stream which began on 2025-08-18, reaching maximum sustained speeds of approximately 700 km/s. The solar wind speed observed at L1 is currently around 450 km/s. 

NASA spacecraft at GEO, MEO and other orbits passing through or in the vicinity of the Earth's outer radiation belt can be impacted.

Activity ID: 2025-08-21T17:10:00-RBE-001.

##

## Message ID: 20250821-AL-002
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

O-type CME detected by STEREO A / GOES / SOHO. 

Start time of the event: 2025-08-21T08:23Z.

Estimated speed: ~1657 km/s.

Estimated opening half-angle: 52 deg.

Direction (lon./lat.): -142/19 in Heliocentric Earth Equatorial coordinates.

Activity ID: 2025-08-21T08:23:00-CME-001

Based on preliminary analysis by the Moon to Mars Space Weather Analysis Office and heliospheric modeling carried out at NASA Community Coordinated Modeling Center, it is estimated that the CME may impact Psyche (glancing blow), Lucy, Europa Clipper, Mars, and Solar Orbiter.  The flank of the CME may reach Psyche at 2025-08-26T18:00Z. The leading edge of the CME will reach Lucy at 2025-08-27T08:11Z, Europa Clipper at 2025-08-25T07:30Z, Mars at 2025-08-24T00:21Z, and Solar Orbiter at 2025-08-22T00:41Z (plus minus 7 hours). 

Links to the movies of the modeled event (includes CME: 2025-08-21T08:23:00-CME-001):

## Community Coordinated Modeling Center Database Of Notifications, Knowledge, Information (CCMC DONKI)
## Message Type: Weekly Space Weather Summary Report for August 13, 2025 - August 19, 2025
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-20T20:59:17Z
## Report Coverage Begin Date: 2025-08-13T00:00Z
## Report Coverage End Date: 2025-08-19T23:59Z
## Message ID: 20250820-7D-001
##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

Solar activity reached moderate levels during this reporting period with 1 M-class flare, 1 O-type CME, and 6 C-type CMEs (see details below).   

Based on preliminary analysis by the Moon to Mars Space Weather Analysis Office and heliospheric modeling carried out at NASA Community Coordinated Modeling Center, it was estimated that the following CMEs were predicted to impact the listed locations:

CME Starting time  | Predicted Impacts (plus minus 7 hours)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
2025-08-13T20:23Z   Juice at 2025-08-15T08:44Z, Juno at 2025-08-28T00:00Z (glancing blow) (see notification 20250813-AL-001).
2025-08-14T19:15Z   BepiColombo at 2025-08-15T18:00Z (glancing blow), Juice at 0205-08-17T10:00Z (glancing blow) (see notification 20250814-AL-002).
2025-08-18T18:24Z   Juice at 2025-08-20T16:13Z, BepiColombo at 2025-08-19T20:00Z (glancing blow) (see notification 20250819-AL-001).

Geomagnetic activity was at minor levels with Kp index (a measure of geomagnetic activity, ranging 0-9) <=4.67 for the reporting period. The highest value of Kp = 4.67 occurred during the synoptic period 2025-08-19T18:00Z-21:00Z. This enhancement in geomagnetic activity was associated with the arrival of a coronal hole high speed stream starting on 2025-08-18 and possibly the embedded arrival of the S-type CME first seen in STEREO A COR2 at 2025-08-17T10:09Z.

The > 2.0 MeV energetic electron flux detected at GOES remained elevated above the threshold level of 1000 pfu for most of the reporting period due to a threshold crossing from the previous reporting period (see notifications 20250810-AL-001, 20250810-AL-002, 20250812-AL-003, 20250814-AL-001, 20250816-AL-001, 20250818-AL-001). This elevation of energetic electron flux levels observed since 2025-08-10T11:45Z was associated with the arrival of a coronal hole high speed stream detected by ACE at L1 on 2025-08-08 with additional influences from an embedded C-type CME first seen in SOHO LASCO C2 at 2025-08-05T16:48Z as detected at L1 by ACE at 2025-08-08T23:46Z. The energetic electron flux levels returned to background levels on 2025-08-18.

The energetic proton flux of >10 MeV protons detected at GOES and the 13-100 MeV protons at STEREO A were all at background levels for the entire reporting period. 

Space Weather Impact:
Space weather impacts on NASA spacecraft are expected to have been moderate this reporting period due to the elevated energetic electron flux in the Earth's outer radiation belt described above.

## Space Weather Outlook:
## Outlook Coverage Begin Date: 2025-08-20T00:00Z 
## Outlook Coverage End Date:  2025-08-26T23:59Z

Solar activity is expected to vary between low and moderate levels during the outlook period. There are currently five Active Regions on the Earth-facing disk. Active Region 14188 (S09E47) and the nearby plage region centered around S10E15 have produced C and M-class level flaring activity and may continue to produce similar levels of activity as it continues to traverse the Earth-facing disk.

Geomagnetic activity is expected to vary between low and moderate levels during the outlook period. A coronal hole centered near N30E40 (as seen in available EUV imagery from SDO/AIA) is expected to cross the central meridian starting on 2025-08-23.

## Message Type: Space Weather Notification - CME (BepiColombo, Juice, STEREO A)
##
## Message Issue Date: 2025-08-20T16:45:02Z

##
## Disclaimer: NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center is the United States Government official source for space weather forecasts. This "Experimental Research Information" consists of preliminary NASA research products and should be interpreted and used accordingly.


## Summary:

O-type CME detected by SOHO. 

Start time of the event: 2025-08-20T03:24Z.

Estimated speed: ~1203 km/s.

Estimated opening half-angle: 10 deg.

Direction (lon./lat.): 70/14 in Heliocentric Earth Equatorial coordinates.

Activity ID: 2025-08-20T03:24:00-CME-001

Based on preliminary analysis by the Moon to Mars Space Weather Analysis Office and heliospheric modeling carried out at NASA Community Coordinated Modeling Center, it is estimated that the CME may impact BepiColombo, Juice (glancing blow), and STEREO A (glancing blow). The leading edge of the CME will reach BepiColombo at 2025-08-20T16:34Z (plus minus 7 hours). The flank of the CME will reach Juice at 2025-08-22T02:00Z, and STEREO A at 2025-08-22T08:00Z (plus minus 7 hours).
